poem:
Builders in Absence

Who will lay the bricks  
of our nation's tomorrow?  
Empty scaffoldings rise,  
echoing the sighs of  
hidden architects.  
In the dust of past kings,  
their hands shaped more  
than walls. Now, shadows  
creep where laughter once  
carried the burden of flight  
to foreign lands.  
Our cities wait in silent  
need, for the return of  
craft.
